The Night Ghost

    1. The bungler in the grip of the demon held
    2. To his crypt by strange means is compelled
    3. And sleeping as a corpse in darkness rotting
    4. He dreams forth the red eyed thing
    5. So rises from the sleeper's breath
    6. Comes the Night Ghost - who brings death!
    1. The Night Ghost climbs, as a shadow leaping, overtop the manor wall
    2. And through an open window goes, as a chilling fog
    3. To the room of the sleeper he creeps
    4. And as a swarm of bugs, overtop her stomach crawls
    5. And on her chest, as a choking darkness sits
    1. 'Til she wakes with a gasp
    2. The Night Ghost; by the window watching, giant as a shadow standing
    3. She claps <clap sound effect> turning on the light
    4. And The Night Ghost, as the darkness in the day, vanishes from all sight.

Molossus Spondee

Oct 19, 2022 • poem • 2019 • the-night-ghost
